text: For many years the Buddha devoted himself to traveling through cities, towns and villages teaching the Teaching, always with infinite compassion. But everywhere there are people who are wary and unobtrusive. Thus, people sometimes rose up to confront the teacher and bitterly insult him. The Buddha never lost his smile and maintained an unshakable calm. His disciples asked him, "Lord, how is it that you are silent when you hear this insults?" And the Buddha replied, "They insult me, certainly, but I do not pick up the insult. FIN
title: La imperturbabilidad del Buda
author: nan Anónimo
